actor_awards.notes: Known as 'The Quintessential Comedienne of the Screen' during the 1930s and 40s.

filmography.title: The Canary Murder Case
filmography.role_description: A young woman caught up in a murder investigation involving a blackmailing showgirl; one of Arthur's first significant talkie roles.
filmography.plot: Detective Philo Vance investigates the murder of a scheming nightclub singer known as 'The Canary' who blackmailed her many suitors.

filmography.title: The Saturday Night Kid
filmography.role_description: The selfish and manipulative sister who tries to steal her virtuous sister's boyfriend.
filmography.plot: Two sisters who work at a department store fight over the same man, with the bad sister framing the good one for theft.

filmography.title: Street of Chance
filmography.role_description: The innocent young wife of a gambler's brother, who tries to keep her husband from falling into the gambling life.
filmography.plot: A legendary gambler tries to prevent his younger brother from following in his footsteps, leading to a tragic high-stakes game.

filmography.title: The Silver Horde
filmography.role_description: A wealthy socialite engaged to a ruthless businessman, who finds herself drawn to a struggling fisherman in Alaska.
filmography.plot: A young man travels to Alaska to make his fortune in the salmon fishing industry and battles a corrupt rival.

filmography.title: Danger Lights
filmography.role_description: A young woman who becomes the center of a rivalry between a railroad boss and an engineer.
filmography.plot: The superintendent of a railroad division risks his job and life to get a critically injured rival to a hospital in Chicago.

filmography.title: The Whole Town's Talking
filmography.role_description: A tough, smart-talking office worker who helps a meek clerk mistaken for a gangster; the role that established her screen persona.
filmography.plot: A timid clerk is mistaken for a vicious public enemy, leading to a series of mix-ups when the police give him a special pass to avoid arrest.

filmography.title: Public Hero No. 1
filmography.role_description: The sister of a notorious gangster who unknowingly falls in love with the undercover federal agent hunting him.
filmography.plot: An undercover agent helps a gangster escape prison to lead him to the rest of the gang, but falls for the gangster's sister.

filmography.title: Diamond Jim
filmography.role_description: A dual role as the two great loves of the legendary businessman Diamond Jim Brady's life.
filmography.plot: A biopic of the flamboyant 19th-century businessman Diamond Jim Brady, focusing on his rise to wealth and his unhappy love life.

filmography.title: If You Could Only Cook
filmography.role_description: An unemployed woman who convinces a millionaire to pose as her husband so they can get jobs as a cook and butler.
filmography.plot: A millionaire meets a girl on a park bench and they agree to pose as a married couple to work as domestic servants for a gangster.

filmography.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
filmography.role_description: A cynical newspaper reporter who poses as a damsel in distress to get the scoop on a naive millionaire, but ends up falling for him.
filmography.plot: A small-town poet inherits a vast fortune and moves to New York City, where he is hounded by greedy opportunists and a reporter.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Director (Frank Capra); Oscar: Nomination – Best Picture

filmography.title: The Ex-Mrs. Bradford
filmography.role_description: A mystery writer who drags her reluctant ex-husband, a doctor, into solving a murder case.
filmography.plot: A surgeon is reunited with his ex-wife, a mystery novelist, and together they solve a murder case involving a jockey.

filmography.title: Adventure in Manhattan
filmography.role_description: An actress who gets involved with a crime reporter who boasts he can predict crimes before they happen.
filmography.plot: A criminology expert and reporter predicts a jewel theft, but no one believes him except the actress he is trying to impress.

filmography.title: The Plainsman
filmography.role_description: The legendary frontierswoman, portrayed as a tough-talking but lovelorn figure devoted to Wild Bill Hickok.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok attempts to stop an Indian uprising that is being fueled by gun-runners, with the help of Calamity Jane.

filmography.title: History Is Made at Night
filmography.role_description: A woman who leaves her jealous shipping magnate husband and falls in love with a charming Parisian headwaiter.
filmography.plot: A jealous husband tries to frame his wife for infidelity, but she escapes to Paris and falls for a man who saves her.

filmography.title: Easy Living
filmography.role_description: A working girl who is mistaken for a millionaire's mistress after a fur coat falls on her head.
filmography.plot: A rich banker throws his wife's fur coat out the window, where it lands on a working girl, leading to a comedy of errors.

filmography.title: You Can't Take It With You
filmography.role_description: The only 'normal' member of an eccentric family who falls in love with the son of a wealthy, stuffy banker.
filmography.plot: A man from a family of rich snobs becomes engaged to a woman from a good-natured but decidedly eccentric family.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Picture; Oscar: Win – Best Director

filmography.title: Only Angels Have Wings
filmography.role_description: A showgirl stranded at a remote South American airfield who falls for the tough head of the air mail service.
filmography.plot: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win a contract.

filmography.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
filmography.role_description: A cynical Washington secretary who initially mocks her naive new boss but eventually helps him fight political corruption.
filmography.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Story; 11 Oscar Nominations

filmography.title: Too Many Husbands
filmography.role_description: A woman who remarries after her first husband is declared dead, only to have him return and demand his place back.
filmography.plot: A woman's first husband, thought drowned, returns home to find her married to his best friend.

filmography.title: Arizona
filmography.role_description: A tough, whip-cracking pioneer woman in 1860s Tucson who dreams of owning the biggest ranch in the territory.
filmography.plot: A headstrong woman in the Arizona Territory battles corrupt rivals and Indians while trying to build a cattle empire.

filmography.title: The Devil and Miss Jones
filmography.role_description: A department store clerk who unwittingly befriends the store's undercover owner and teaches him about the lives of his employees.
filmography.plot: A tycoon goes undercover as a shoe clerk in his own department store to ferret out union agitators but ends up sympathizing with them.

filmography.title: The Talk of the Town
filmography.role_description: A spirited schoolteacher who rents her home to a Supreme Court nominee while hiding a fugitive wrongfully accused of arson.
filmography.plot: An escaped prisoner and a law professor contend for the hand of a spirited schoolteacher while exposing a corrupt town administration.

filmography.title: The More the Merrier
filmography.role_description: A government worker in WWII Washington D.C. who reluctantly shares her apartment with two men, leading to romance and comedy.
filmography.plot: During the WWII housing shortage in Washington D.C., a woman rents her apartment to two men, and the older one plays matchmaker.

filmography.title: A Foreign Affair
filmography.role_description: A strait-laced congresswoman investigating morale in post-war Berlin who falls for a captain involved with a former Nazi singer.
filmography.plot: A congressional committee visits occupied Berlin to investigate troop morale, where a congresswoman suspects a singer is being protected by an American officer.

filmography.title: Shane
filmography.role_description: A homesteader's wife who finds herself drawn to a mysterious gunfighter who protects her family; Arthur's final film role.
filmography.plot: A weary gunfighter attempts to settle down with a homestead family, but a smoldering settler/rancher conflict forces him to act.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography; National Film Registry (Inducted 1993)
